word:
Let every one who claims to be a disciple of Christ say, "By the grace of God I will hold fast my integrity. Get thee behind me, Satan. I will not, under any consideration, enter into a 


                    -7- 

confederacy with your hellish powers." Such determination is uncommon in the market-place, uncommon in men of business; but let it not continue to be a rare thing in the medical profession; for above every other calling, this requires men of sterling integrity,--men who will not break their contracts, or be bought or sold. . . .
